answers.text: the 1972 Munich Massacre of Israeli athletes at the Olympic Games

qas.question: How many Oscar nominations did 'Munich' get?
In what year was the book Vengeance published?
Who did the score for Sword of Gideon?
How many Israeli athletes died during the 1972 Munich Massacre?
What was George Jonas' first novel to be published?

context: <b6_0>Spielberg<b6_0/>'s film Munich, about the events following <a0_0>the 1972 Munich Massacre of Israeli athletes at the Olympic Games<a0_0/>, was his second film essaying Jewish relations in the world (the first being Schindler's List). The film is based on <a1_0><b9_0>Vengeance<b9_0/><a1_0/>, a book by Canadian journalist <a2_0>George Jonas<a2_0/>. It was previously adapted into the <b5_0>1986<b5_0/> made-for-TV film Sword of Gideon. The film received strong critical praise, but underperformed at the U.S. and world box-office; it remains one of Spielberg's most controversial films to date. Munich received <a3_0><b8_0>five<b8_0/><a3_0/> Academy Awards nominations, including Best Picture, Film Editing, Original Music Score (by <a4_0><b7_0>John Williams<b7_0/><a4_0/>), Best Adapted Screenplay, and Best Director for Spielberg. It was Spielberg's sixth Best Director nomination and fifth Best Picture nomination.
